tool.name: AppTool

param.name: TemplateSpreadsheet
param.dialogReference: The formatted spreadsheet that will be updated with Portal or AGOL web application details. Defaults to LaDOTD_WebApps_Autopopulate.xlsx in the same folder as the python toolbox script.
param.pythonReference: The formatted spreadsheet that will be updated with Portal or AGOL web application details. Defaults to LaDOTD_WebApps_Autopopulate.xlsx in the same folder as the python toolbox script.

param.name: outdir
param.dialogReference: Output folder for text files and a populated version of the .xlsx file.
param.pythonReference: Output folder for text files and a populated version of the .xlsx file.

param.name: ImportPortalDetails
param.dialogReference: Optional: Existing .txt file with portal service details, created either through a previous run with "Create New Portal Service Table and Load Data" checked, or created using the Portal Services inventory tool. Adds links to service details to each web application tab.
param.pythonReference: Optional: Existing .txt file with portal service details, created either through a previous run with "Create New Portal Service Table and Load Data" checked, or created using the Portal Services inventory tool. Adds links to service details to each web application tab.

param.name: GetPortalDetails
param.displayname: Create New Portal Service Table and Load Data
param.dialogReference: Optional: Run the Portal Services inventory tool using the active portal in the current ArcGIS Pro instance. Adds links to service details to each web application tab.
param.pythonReference: Optional: Run the Portal Services inventory tool using the active portal in the current ArcGIS Pro instance. Adds links to service details to each web application tab.

param.name: Port
param.dialogReference: When running outside of ArcGIS Pro, pass a portal object to this script to inventory the portal.
param.pythonReference: When running outside of ArcGIS Pro, pass a portal object to this script to inventory the portal.

tool.summary: Inventory web mapping applications (web apps) in ArcGIS Online or Portal. Optionally link to underlying services, data stores, and databases. When accessed from ArcGIS Pro, this tool uses the credentials and AGOL or Portal environment of the active ArcGIS Pro session. Outside of ArcGIS Pro, a portal object can be passed to the tool.

scriptExample.title: Create Web Application Report (stand-alone script)
scriptExample.para: The following code shows how to use the Web App Inventory outside of ArcGIS Pro.
scriptExample.code:
#Import the required GIS modules import arcpy, arcgis
arcpy.ImportToolbox("C:/temp/WebInventoryToolboxForOutsideOfPro.pyt")
#Log into the desired portal (the higher the user's permissions # on the portal, the more comprehensive the inventory) gisportal = arcgis.gis.GIS("https://maps.agency.gov/portal", "myusername", "mypassword")
#Run the script using an existing portal services inventory table. arcpy.webtoolbox.AppTool("C:/temp/WebApps_Autopopulate.xlsx", r"C:\temp\OutputFolder", r"C:\temp\servicesinventory_MM-DD-20YY_HHMM_PM.txt", None, gisportal)
#Alternatively, run the script and generate a new portal services table. arcpy.webtoolbox.AppTool("C:/temp/WebApps_Autopopulate.xlsx", r"C:\temp\OutputFolder", None, True, gisportal)

scriptExample.title: Create Web Application Report (Python window)
scriptExample.para: The following code shows how to use the Web App Inventory within ArcGIS Pro. The script demonstrates using the tool for AGOL, but it can also be used when logged into a Portal. If the user is logged into a Portal in ArcGIS Pro, the portal services table can also be included or generated for greater detail. Similar functionality is not yet available for AGOL.
scriptExample.code:
#Run the script for AGOL (this doesn't support generating or using a portal services table). #Log into an AGOL active portal in ArcGIS Pro before running the script
arcpy.webtoolbox.AppTool("C:/temp/WebApps_Autopopulate.xlsx", r"C:\temp\OutputFolder", None, None, '')
